Years and years of clean usage here on TPB. Using PB1.1, plus add-on lists in uT. This past Sunday, I decide to DL this on a whim (seeing no notice of DMCA from users), and suddenly I'm getting a DMCA notice from Comcast:

"Notice of Action under the Digital Millennium Copyright Act

Abuse Incident Number:      NA0000045779909
Report Date/Time:           Fri, 22 Jun 2012 18:38:12 -0700

Evidentiary Information:
Notice ID:  255-2750099
Title:  The Avengers
Title:  The Avengers
Protocol:  BitTorrent
IP Address:  24.10.158.37
DNS:  c-24-10-158-37.hsd1.ut.comcast.net
Port ID:  17310
File Name:  The Avengers 2012 TS XViD-sC0rp File Size:  746612737
Timestamp:  22 Jun 2012 23:05:42 GMT
URL (if applicable): http://ipv4.tracker.harry.lu/announce
Bay ID:  0754caa42b5dfb9fda31b53bbcffdca743b72c96|746612737"

Oh no you got a notification from your ISP! That isn't the uploader's fault. If you're going to dl torrents then it's all about CYA (cover your ass) cause no one else is going to do it for you. There are ways to avoid being tracked such as using the infamous PeerBlock which updates its P2P lists just about daily to keep our filching pirate butts out of trouble. Don't spam out the torrents because you aren't being careful enough, they have enough issues with covering their own asses and don't have the time to be worried about you.
